topic.title: Providing easy-to-find information to users experiencing problems
topic.shortdesc: When troubleshooting information is developed in discrete units (topics, sections, steps, or specific types of notes), it is easier for users to locate. It also can be marked with specific cues (verbal or visual) to make it easily recognizable.

body.p: Research by Hans van der Meij, minimalism guru at the University of Twente in the Netherlands, tells us that problem-solving information should be marked by a visual or verbal cue to make it easily accessible to users. We recommend that you use images and labels to make the troubleshooting elements in your content quickly recognizable and easy-to-find.
